data.title: OBSERVE
questions: In this phase, review what happened in the meeting.
Did the meeting start/end on time?
Was the agenda stated? Posted? Followed?
Was the purpose clearly articulated? Agreed to?
Was an objective clearly stated? Achieved?
Were ground rules set? Posted? Followed?
How would you rate the participation? What % participated?
How would you rate the energy level? Scale 1 – 10?

data.title: INFER
questions: In this phase, explore other inferences about the meeting
How would you describe the overall ‘mood’?
To what extent was creativity/fun encouraged?
To what extent were questions answe#cc2229 satisfactorily?
What went unanswe#cc2229/unexplo#cc2229? What was missing?
What learning occur#cc2229? What insights were gained?
To what extent were learnings and insights explicitly communicated?
To what extent did the meeting move the group forward?

data.title: CONSIDER
questions: In this phase, consider how the ‘people’ issues were handled.
Were people respected/heard? Did anyone feel disrespected?
Did anything happen which might impact trust or rapport among attendees?
How diverse was the group? Scale 1 – 10? What were missing perspective(s)?
To what extent did every attendee feel included? Scale 1 – 10?
What cultural norms were observed? Were any challenged? How so?
What needs, interests or concerns went unaddressed? Need to follow-up?
What biases did you hear? From whom? Were the biases confronted? How?

data.title: CONCLUDE
questions: In this phase, analyze the meeting’s output, and identify improvement steps.
How productive was the meeting? To what extent was the objective achieved?
How efficient was the meeting, in achieving the agenda? Scale 1 – 10.
What decisions/conclusions were reached by the group? Communicated?
Who committed to what action(s)? By when? How being held accountable?
What went well in the meeting? How will you reinforce that next time?
What could have gone better or faster? How will you improve next time?
How will you lead this type meeting differently in the future?
